usefulItems: baking paper, biscuit or scone cutter (6-7 cm), wire rack, baking tray (30 x 40 cm), silicone bread mat, sealable container, oven
title: Buttermilk scones

ingredients.content: 440 g self-raising flour, plus extra for dusting

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 220°C. Line a baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place flour, sugar, salt and butter into mixing bowl and mix <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>, or until mixture resembles breadcrumbs.
Add buttermilk and combine <b>20 sec/speed 5<b>, then knead <b>20 sec/<b>.

Transfer dough onto a silicone bread mat or floured work surface and press out to a 2 cm thickness. Dip a biscuit or scone cutter (6-7 cm) into flour and cut out scones (approx. 10). Repeat until all dough has been used.
Place scones onto prepared tray, so that each scone is touching the next, then bake for 12-15 minutes (220°C), or until lightly golden.
Allow to cool on tray for 5 minutes before transferring onto a wire rack. Serve warm, or allow to cool completely before placing into a sealable container to store until ready to serve.

hintsAndTricks: Serve with whipped cream or Coppa del nonno and Mixed berry jam, please see recipes on this recipe chip.
